computer.description:
This computer was created and made in France by a company called RTC. It was the first home computer released by Philips. It was not MSX compliant and or compatible with the other Philips VG computers. The basic was written by Microsoft.
It was designed to be a cheap computer for beginners and school purpose. Philips planned to develop a lot of peripherals for this computer : synthetiser, memory card, floppy disk unit, videodisc interface, etc... but none of them was realised. Finally, it had a limited success.

shot.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> KEYBOARD CLOSE-UP</strong></font><br><blockquote>Philips chose the French company RTC (RadioTechnique Compelec) to manufacture the VG 5000. This company also manufactured the French 'Minitel' videotext terminal which keyboard was very similar to the VG 5000 one. </blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> ELECTRONIC BOARDS</strong></font><br><blockquote>Same kind of electronic board design can be found in other RTC products like, for example, the Philips/Schneider/Radiola Videopac game consoles.<br><br> <b><font color="blue">(1)</font></b> Tape recorder interface card<br> <b><font color="blue">(2)</font></b> Keyboard connector<br> <b><font color="blue">(3)</font></b> 16 KB ROM holding the Microsoft BASIC interpreter<br> <b><font color="blue">(4-5)</font></b> 2x8 KB RAM chips (Nec 4168) hold the 16 KB of user RAM<br> <b><font color="blue">(6)</font></b> Z80A processor, here a SGS version<br> <b><font color="blue">(7)</font></b> Thomson EF-9345 video chip. Also holds 110 ASCII characters and 128 graphic characters. 192 additional characters could be defined by the user. <br> <b><font color="blue">(8)</font></b> 8 KB video RAM dedicated to text and graphic display.</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> COMPLETE SYSTEM</strong></font><br><blockquote>Power supply, expansion pack, dot matrix printer, 2 x joysticks, cassette recorder, ROM cartridges and cassette software.</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> ALL-IN-ONE</strong></font><br><blockquote>This strange and massive 'all plastic' console integrates color display, computer, joysticks, cassette recorder and handbook. With some imagination, it looks like the StarTrek Enterprise spaceship's main desk !</blockquote>
